headline: Is Walmart Still Attractive After Its 25% Surge And E Commerce Expansion In 2025?
summary: If you are wondering whether Walmart is still attractive after its huge run, or if the easy money has already been made, this breakdown is for you. Walmart has climbed 3.0% over the last week, 10.7% in the last month, and is now up 24.9% year to date and 20.2% over the past year, capping a 135.0% gain over 3 years and 143.8% over 5 years. Recent headlines have focused on Walmart leaning further into e commerce, expanding same day delivery, and sharpening its private label strategy as it...

headline: Heard on the Street Recap: Betting on Cuts
summary: The Dow industrials added 0.9% and the Nasdaq composite gained 0.2%.  The "modest fall" should be enough to persuade Federal Reserve policymakers to vote for another rate cut next week, said Stephen Brown of Capital Economics.  The retailer’s stock was up 1.8%, a gain that pushed it above the market-cap milestone and made it the 12th U.S. company to surpass it, according to Dow Jones Market Data.

headline: BMO and Walmart Canada Team Up to Make Shopping Fast, Convenient and Affordable
summary: BMO today announced a new strategic collaboration with Walmart Canada to bring greater value and flexibility to Canadians by delivering convenient access to unlimited, free same-day delivery on groceries and everyday essentials at affordable prices. This collaboration reflects the bank's commitment to helping Canadians make real financial progress by saving them time and money on their everyday needs.
